contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox comics creator | birth_name = Philippe Vandevelde | birth_date = {{birth date and age|df=yes|1957|2|24}} | birth_place = [[Brussels]], [[Belgium]] | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = Belgian | area = writer | alias = | notable works = ''[[Soda (comics)|Soda]]''<br/>''[[Spirou et Fantasio]]''<br/>''[[Le Petit Spirou]]'' | awards = [[#Awards|full list]] }} '''Philippe Vandevelde''', working under the pseudonym '''Tome''' (born 24 February 1957 in [[Brussels]]), is a [[comics]] script writer. He is known for collaborations with [[Jean-Richard Geurts|Janry]] on ''[[Spirou et Fantasio]]'' and ''[[Le Petit Spirou]]'', and with [[Luc Warnant]] and later [[Bruno Gazzotti]] on ''[[Soda (comics)|Soda]]''. More recently he has collaborated with [[Ralph Meyer]] on ''Berceuse assassine'', and with [[Marc Hardy]] on ''Feux''. == Biography == An operation left him blind for a short while at the age of eight. His first experiences of comics were of the ''[[The Adventures of Tintin|Tintin]]'' story ''[[King Ottokar's Sceptre]]'' and ''[[Corentin (comics)|Corentin]]'' read aloud to him.{{Citation needed|date=October 2007}} Under the pseudonyms "Phil" and "Tom", he published his first illustrations and comics for the school magazine ''Buck'' (made by [[Thierry Groensteen]]) from 1972 to 1974. His first comic was a medieval parody ''Estrel, le troubadour''. Tome began his professional comics career in the studio of [[Dupa]], the author of ''[[Cubitus]]'', where he met Janry who would become a long-time collaborator.<small><ref name="lambiek-tome">{{Cite web|last=Lambiek Comiclopedia|title=Tome|url= http://lambiek.net/artists/t/tome.htm}}</ref></small> After assisting [[Turk (comics)|Turk]] and [[De Groot]] on series such as ''[[Léonard (comics)|Léonard]]'' and ''[[Clifton (comics)|Clifton]]'', they began working at the [[Franco-Belgian comics magazines|comics magazine]] ''[[Spirou (magazine)|Spirou]]'' in 1979, their first assignment the games page ''Jeureka''. In 1980 they began work on their first ''[[Spirou et Fantasio]]'' adventure, the iconic forty-year-old series of ''Spirou''.<small><ref name="lambiek-tome"/></small> Previously created by a succession of authors including the famous [[André Franquin]], Tome and Janry were given the task in alternation with another creative team of [[Nic Broca|Nic]] and [[Raoul Cauvin|Cauvin]]. Eventually assuming sole responsibility of the series, Tome and Janry continued creating stories until 1998, completing 14 albums, in addition to creating ''[[Le Petit Spirou]]'', a series about [[Spirou (character)|Spirou]]'s youth, for which they made 14 albums since 1990. ==Bibliography== *''Spirou et Fantasio'' *''Le Petit Spirou'' *''Soda'' *"Feux" *"Sur la Route de Selma" *Berceuse Assassine" *"Les Minoukini" *"Le Gang Mazda" {{Expand section|date=May 2011}} ==Awards== * 1992: [[Angoulême International Comics Festival Humour award|Humour Award]] and [[Angoulême International Comics Festival Prix Jeunesse 9-12 ans|Youth Award (9-12 years)]] at the [[Angoulême International Comics Festival]], [[France]]<small><ref name="toutenBD-awards92">{{cite web | url =http://www.toutenbd.com/article.php3?id_article=834 | title =Le Palmarès 1992 | work =ToutEnBD | language = French }}</ref></small> * 2000: nominated for Best German-language Comic for Children and Young People at the [[Max & Moritz Prizes]], [[Germany]] :: -
